BOT - Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/86.15.249.33|86.15.249.33]] {[[User:VoABot_II/Help#Revert_reasons|possible vandalism]]} to last version by [[Special:Contributions/Thecurran|Thecurran]].
/* Continuing Accusations of Deicide */ I'm iffy on putting this in the Middle Ages part.
/* Medieval Accusations of Deicide */ If you'll check the references, you'll see that "continuing" is the right word here, as it references accusations that have persisted until contemporary times.
/* Bans on kosher slaughter */ what has capital punishment to do with kosher slaughter?
/* Bans on kosher and halal slaughter */ halal slaughter is not relevant here
/* Bans on kosher and halal slaughter */
/* Bans on kosher slaughter */ Added anti-Muslim & anti-Chassid parts.
/* Continuing accusations of deicide */ "Continuing" is the wrong word as it denotes modern day practice, which both external references clearly refute.

prophet more precise word, with resonances in both cultures
/* New antisemitism */ del reference that does not support claim
/* New antisemitism */ del link to online discussion/blog unreliable source
/* Bans on kosher slaughter */ del tautology
/* Bans on kosher slaughter */ avoid redirect in see also link
/* Bans on kosher slaughter */ rv vandalism
/* Forms */ Sixth bullet was recently removed, so now five. Question remains: How many DID Flannery list in the cited work? Five or only four?
/* Twentieth century */ removed ambiguous unsourced quote that could be about atheists vs. religion; request cite for other quotes.

/* Forms */ we need a [[WP:RS|reliable source]] for that, as per actual use; [[WP:NOR|original thougts]] about antisemitism as aggregating the semites in anti-Arabism usually not historically grounded
/* Forms */ Adjusted format so six varieties are each bulleted. Edited variety 6 to be closer to WP:NPOV. NOT sure if 6th is true, but at least is now more neutral in phrasing.

/* Twentieth century */ not sure why this is tagged, this section has sources

remove non-source, fix wording to be accurate, remove recently inserted [[WP:NOR|original research]] to Talk: page for further discussion
Refined and clarified that the term's etymology *indicates* hostility toward all Semitic people (not "may imply" - etymology is not arguable). Added a date and reference for the term's current usage
